title: Conditions for Two Categorical Variables
question_text:
To celebrate her school's $50\text{th}$ anniversary, the principal is ordering school-colored t-shirts for all the students at her school. Students will order a t-shirt, selecting a color (red or blue) and a size (small, medium, or large). Here is the distribution of t-shirt orders for a random sample of $178$ of the school's students:
red blue total
small $31$ $22$ $53$
medium $21$ $16$ $37$
large $50$ $38$ $88$
total $102$ $76$ $178$
The principal wants to test the claim Ho: Shirt Color and Size are independent. To do so, which of the following conditions must be met before the principal can use a $\chi^2$ procedure in this situation?

choices.text: The number of categories of shirt size must be large relative to the number of categories of t-shirt color.
Every student in the school must order a t-shirt; this way, the principal will have a completed order.
All expected counts must be at least $5$.
The distribution of shirt sizes must be approximately Normal.
All observed counts must be greater than $5$.
